xml:
STS-28 Mission: Department of Defense Space Shuttle: Columbia Launch Pad: 39B Launched: August 8, 1989, 8:37:00 a.m. EDT Landing Site: Edwards Air Force Base, Calif. Landing: August 13, 1989, 6:37:08 a.m. PDT Mission Duration: 5 days, 1 hour, 0 minutes, 8 seconds Orbit Altitude: Classified Orbit Inclination: 57 degrees
Fourth mission dedicated to the Department of Defense, and first flight of Columbia since Mission 61-C.
Crew consisted of Commander Brewster H. Shaw Jr., Pilot Richard N. Richards, Mission Specialists James C. Adamson, David C. Leestma and Mark N. Brown.
